channel.title: Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT
channel.description: Recent content in Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT

item.title: ModeS3 - SmartCity Intro
item.description: MoDeS3 – Smart City project integrates these innovative solutions into a common framework and testbed.

item.title: ActivIoTy - Checkpoints on the Move?
item.description: We are on the last mile of the challenge, and I’m exploring new ways to enrich the user experience of the platform, adding new features.

item.title: Trusted IoT - Parallelizing IOTA transactions in Kura
item.description: What’s the fuss about? From now on, Jura is scalable in terms of locations stored in the tangle. How? Using IOTA’s workers.

item.title: Autonomy of Things - Location Awareness in IoT with Beacon Technology
item.description: In this article I’ll share the findings of my feasibility tests for implementing a location service with Bluetooth beacon using iOS and Linux-powered devices.

item.title: Cloud Oscilloscope - Backend Architecture
item.description: We’re working on a backend for our Cloud Oscilloscope project. On the last meetings we decided to use common technologies for IoT to connect our device with backend.

item.title: Trusted IoT - The Race to the Tangle II: Teamwork
item.description: This post is a continuation of the race to the tangle in which we discuss how we try to increase the number of transactions we make to the tangle with the hardware we have.

item.title: Trync - Installing and configuring Mosquitto MQTT broker
item.description: For communicating between Trync gateways (trync-g) and Trync main server we are using MQTT and we have chosen Mosquitto MQTT broker.

item.title: Trync - Installing and configuring WildFly application server with a Let's Encrypt SSL/TLS certificate
item.description: We are using WildFly application server for hosting Trync dashboard and its services written in Java. Following steps will describe how we configured WildFly on our DigitalOcean droplet running CentOS 7.4.

item.title: Trync - Server infrastructure for Trync
item.description: For deploying Trync dashboard and services we have choose a DigitalOcean droplet running CentOS 7.4.

item.title: Trusted IoT - Testing: One, two, three
item.description: This weekend we have met up in order to perform some experiments, and taking advantage of this meeting we are going to show you how to install Jura.

item.title: Trusted IoT - Firma: In IOTA We Trust
item.description: We are pleased to present Firma, the last part of Jura. “Firmar” is the Spanish word of the verb “to sign” and the translation of firma in English is “it signs”.

item.title: ActivIoTy - The (Activ-IoTy) Controller
item.description: The Controller is a MQTT subscriber that processes the checkins performed on Checkpoints.

item.title: Trusted IoT - Our Approach. Part II. Trusted IPS
item.description: We have been waiting to post this for weeks. It is not because we are playing hard to get, we just wanted to see how far we could go :)

item.title: Trusted IoT - The Race to the Tangle
item.description: These days we are using the starter kit that we got for our proposal for the Eclipse Open IoT Challenge 4.0 to carry out different tests.

item.title: Alya - A React component for getting YouTube videos using voice
item.description: A week ago, we have introduced our new project “Alya” in participation for Eclipse Open IoT Challenge , “Alya” is a modular personalized open-source smart mirror. In this blog, I am excited to talk about one of the core addons…
